Count values in a character vector

Source: R/count-char.R
count.character.Rd

Method for dplyr::count()

# S3 method for character
count(x, sort = FALSE, prop = FALSE)

Arguments

x

A character vector.

sort

If TRUE, sort the result so that the most common values float to the top.

prop

If TRUE, compute the fraction of marginal table.

Value

A tibble of element counts

Examples

x <- sample(LETTERS)[rpois(1000, 10)]
table(x)
#> x
#>   A   C   E   F   G   H   I   K   L   M   N   O   P   R   S   T   U   V   W   Z 
#>  95   7  15   8  17  36  36 104  73  18 126   1 129  99  51   2  53   2 126   2 
dplyr::count(x)
#> # A tibble: 20 × 2
#>    x         n
#>    <chr> <int>
#>  1 A        95
#>  2 C         7
#>  3 E        15
#>  4 F         8
#>  5 G        17
#>  6 H        36
#>  7 I        36
#>  8 K       104
#>  9 L        73
#> 10 M        18
#> 11 N       126
#> 12 O         1
#> 13 P       129
#> 14 R        99
#> 15 S        51
#> 16 T         2
#> 17 U        53
#> 18 V         2
#> 19 W       126
#> 20 Z         2
dplyr::count(x, sort = TRUE, prop = TRUE)
#> # A tibble: 20 × 3
#>    x         n     p
#>    <chr> <int> <dbl>
#>  1 P       129 0.129
#>  2 W       126 0.126
#>  3 N       126 0.126
#>  4 K       104 0.104
#>  5 R        99 0.099
#>  6 A        95 0.095
#>  7 L        73 0.073
#>  8 U        53 0.053
#>  9 S        51 0.051
#> 10 I        36 0.036
#> 11 H        36 0.036
#> 12 M        18 0.018
#> 13 G        17 0.017
#> 14 E        15 0.015
#> 15 F         8 0.008
#> 16 C         7 0.007
#> 17 Z         2 0.002
#> 18 V         2 0.002
#> 19 T         2 0.002
#> 20 O         1 0.001
